abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column provides highlights from exhibition Mapping Ahab’s ‘Storied Waves’ — Whaling and the Geography of ‘Moby-Dick,' featuring logbooks and personal journals regarding 19th-century whaling, at New Bedford Whaling Museum in Massachusetts.
lead_paragraph: Dying whales and sailors’ burials at sea evoke “the age of sail” in 19th-century illustrations at the New Bedford Whaling Museum in Massachusetts.

headline.main: In Maritime Logbooks, a Trove of ‘Extraordinary’ Imagery
headline.print_headline: Artists, Ahoy! Logbook Illustrations of Maritime Dramas

snippet: Dying whales and sailors’ burials at sea evoke “the age of sail” in 19th-century illustrations at the New Bedford Whaling Museum in Massachusetts.
